full_threads.body: Just a friendly reminder that this ticket has been open for over 5 days. Please close it if it's resolved or follow up if necessary. Thanks!

Hi again,

So just to raise another flag.

One of the customers who have advised us that there were other details appearing with there order had never ordered from us before, but the email address that came through on her order (Karen McCutcheon 30929, as a guest), was the same as an order that came through for a Total Eyecare patient earlier in the day (Theresa Wise 30918, as a subscriber)

Karen (30292) wasn't able to confidently recall the other person's details, she advised us that it was maybe Trish Willett and that it was a reorder (but it sounds like it could've actually been Theresa Wise, as Trish Willett doesn't exist in Woo Commerce).

I have updated Karen's profile to be the email address she used for her customer support query.

Kind regards,

Elise


​http://www.totalcontacts.com.au/

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts

Hi Heath,

Thank you for looking into it.

I go on leave 24/12/24, and will return on 02/01/24.
My colleague Marjorie will be monitoring Total Contacts for me next week, and will report if we have another bout of "failed payment" attempts like what I saw this morning.

Kind regards,

Elise


​http://www.totalcontacts.com.au/

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts
Thanks Heath, much appreciated. Have a nice Christmas:)

Hi Elise,

We have looked into this and have found what should be a solution.

In short the 'I have a prescription from Total Eye Care' checkbox was hidden with code as it was appearing across 100+ products. The recent 'attack' was able to read this code, before the website was hiding it. This enabled the code to 'check' the box and to proceed with an order.

We have now manually deleted this option from all products, so the exploit no longer exists.

We can see a couple of what appear to be 'real' orders have come through since, so it appears the issue now fixed. The checkout page is also back in action.

We will continue to monitor the orders over the coming days.

Hi Joel,

We received this email later on Friday:

Name: David Equid
Please select your preferred method of contact:: Email
Phone:
Email: squid_59@hotmail.com
Message: I logged into your website using the same details as per previous orders, all my account details were correct when I checked. I selected the products I want, then when I get to the CHECKOUT page it is filled in with someone else's details!
This is very concerning from a security viewpoint; does it mean others are seeing my details just like I am??
Even after I typed over the other person's details with my own and made payment using PayPal, the screen I was returned to was again filled out with the same, other person's details.
Clearly there is a serious issue with your system that needs to be rectified ASAP to address this security breach.

---

Date: December 20, 2024
Time: 5:18 pm

I also opened the inbox today to see 58 "failed payment" orders, all attempted within the last 7 hours, all flagged as "TECO Px" orders (which is impossible now, as we had that option removed months ago).

It was a similar thing last Monday, but there was only 7 or 8.

What is happening?

Kind regards,

Elise


​http://www.totalcontacts.com.au/

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts

Hi Elise,

We have made updates to the site.

  • Regarding 1-Day Acuvue Moist for Astigmatism (30), we have fixed the variation of the product
  • Removed the caching tool to site
  • made updates to the scripts.

Can you try now?

Hello again,I've had a look at all the info she is trying to put in, and there appears to be a glitch with the 1-Day Acuvue Moist for Astigmatism (30) product, where I can input an axis for all the cyl's except for when the -1.25 is chosenBUT this only appears to be an issue when trying to order in the Right eye field.The Left eye field has no issues in terms of inputting script.There's more: Even if I just do one eye only for the 1-Day Acuvue Moist for Astigmatism (30) and put in the details for the Left eye, when I go to cart is tells me it's a completely different product that's in there with a completely different script - of which I can't clear:
And when I click on "view cart" for the subtotal of $48.80, it takes me to a cart with the subtotal of $120.80

I have no idea what's going on?

Kind regards,

Elise


​http://www.totalcontacts.com.au/

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Good afternoon,

This customer is trying to place a re-order, and long story short is the axis option for her R eye does not appear in the re-ordered cart (original order was March 2024 # 20911, there were no issues).

I have asked that she clears her caches, and to start the ordering process from the beginning instead of using the re-order function in an attempt to reset her profile details, but is there anything that you can think of that would cause this?

We have had a few instances the past 6-8 weeks where astigmatic lenses have been ordered and the cyl and axis component of the scripts have been omitted from the order when formatted into the email. This has affected both new customers ordering for the first time, and existing customers utilising the re-order function.


Kind regards,


Elise


​www.totalcontacts.com.au

https://www.facebook.com/totalcontacts
